Data.event_text: Lithuania officially adopts the euro as its currency, replacing the litas, and becomes the 19th Eurozone country.

links.text: -Kropaitas, Zivile (January 1, 2015). "Lithuania joins Baltic neighbours in euro club". BBC News. Archived from the original on July 3, 2021. Retrieved January 1, 2015.-
-Kropaitas, Zivile (January 1, 2015). "Lithuania joins Baltic neighbours in euro club". BBC News. Archived from the original on July 3, 2021. Retrieved January 1, 2015.-

Data.event_text: 7  A series of massacres in Baga, Nigeria and surrounding villages by Boko Haram kills more than 2,000 people.

Two gunmen belonging to Al-Qaeda's Yemen branch kill 12 people and injure 11 more at the Paris headquarters of satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo, prompting an anti-terrorism demonstration attended by over a million people and more than 40 world leaders.
A Boko Haram and Islamic State assault on Kolofata in the Far North Region of Cameroon is repelled by the Cameroonian Army, who kill 143 Boko Haram and Islamic State insurgents.

links.text: -Calamur, Krishnadev (January 13, 2015). "143 Boko Haram Fighters Killed In Clashes With Cameroon's Military". Colorado Public Radio. Archived from the original on April 19, 2022. Retrieved April 19, 2022.-

-Calamur, Krishnadev (January 13, 2015). "143 Boko Haram Fighters Killed In Clashes With Cameroon's Military". Colorado Public Radio. Archived from the original on April 19, 2022. Retrieved April 19, 2022.-

Data.event_text: The Swiss National Bank abandons the cap on the franc's value relative to the euro, causing turmoil in international financial markets.

links.text: -"'Francogeddon' as Swiss franc ends euro cap". BBC News. January 16, 2015. Archived from the original on January 17, 2015. Retrieved January 19, 2015.-
-"'Francogeddon' as Swiss franc ends euro cap". BBC News. January 16, 2015. Archived from the original on January 17, 2015. Retrieved January 19, 2015.-

-"'Francogeddon': New Zealand foreign exchange broker shuts after Swiss national bank scraps currency cap". Australian Broadcasting Corporation. January 17, 2015. Archived from the original on January 19, 2015. Retrieved January 19, 2015.-

-"'Francogeddon': New Zealand foreign exchange broker shuts after Swiss national bank scraps currency cap". Australian Broadcasting Corporation. January 17, 2015. Archived from the original on January 19, 2015. Retrieved January 19, 2015.-

Data.event_text: After Houthi forces seize the presidential palace, Yemeni President Abd Rabbuh Mansur Hadi resigns after months of unrest.

links.text: -"Yemen president quits amid worsening crisis". Al Jazeera. January 22, 2015. Archived from the original on January 23, 2015. Retrieved January 24, 2015.-
-"Yemen president quits amid worsening crisis". Al Jazeera. January 22, 2015. Archived from the original on January 23, 2015. Retrieved January 24, 2015.-

Data.event_text: Legislative elections are held in Greece to elect all 300 members of the Hellenic Parliament and the SYRIZA party, led by Alexis Tsipras, comes out as the largest party winning 149 out of 300 seats.

links.text: -"Parliamentary Elections January 2015". ekloges-prev.singularlogic.eu. Archived from the original on January 26, 2015. Retrieved March 27, 2022.-
-"Parliamentary Elections January 2015". ekloges-prev.singularlogic.eu. Archived from the original on January 26, 2015. Retrieved March 27, 2022.-
-"Greece election: Anti-austerity Syriza wins election". BBC News. January 26, 2015. Archived from the original on March 24, 2022. Retrieved March 27, 2022.-
-"Greece election: Anti-austerity Syriza wins election". BBC News. January 26, 2015. Archived from the original on March 24, 2022. Retrieved March 27, 2022.-
-"Greek leftist leader Tsipras claims victory over austerity". Reuters. January 25, 2015. Archived from the original on March 27, 2022. Retrieved March 27, 2022.-
-"Greek leftist leader Tsipras claims victory over austerity". Reuters. January 25, 2015. Archived from the original on March 27, 2022. Retrieved March 27, 2022.-

Data.event_text: Leaders from Russian Federation, Ukraine, Germany and French Republic reach an agreement on the war in eastern Ukraine that includes a ceasefire and withdrawal of heavy weapons. However, several days later, the Ukrainian government and pro-Russian rebels claim that, within its first day, the ceasefire was broken 139 times, as both sides failed to withdraw their heavy weapons and fighting had continued.

links.text: -"Ukraine crisis: Leaders agree peace roadmap". BBC. February 12, 2015. Archived from the original on February 12, 2015. Retrieved February 12, 2015.-
-"Ukraine crisis: Leaders agree peace roadmap". BBC. February 12, 2015. Archived from the original on February 12, 2015. Retrieved February 12, 2015.-

-"Ukraine crisis: Kiev and pro-Russian rebels claim ceasefire was broken '139 times' on first day as both sides fail to withdraw heavy weapons". The Independent. London. February 17, 2015. Archived from the original on May 1, 2022. Retrieved February 17, 2015.-

-"Ukraine crisis: Kiev and pro-Russian rebels claim ceasefire was broken '139 times' on first day as both sides fail to withdraw heavy weapons". The Independent. London. February 17, 2015. Archived from the original on May 1, 2022. Retrieved February 17, 2015.-

Data.event_text: The United Nations Security Council adopts Resolution 2199 to combat terrorism.

links.text: -"Unanimously Adopting Resolution 2199 (2015), Security Council Condemns Trade with Al-Qaida Associated Groups, Threatens Further Targeted Sanctions". United Nations. February 12, 2015. Archived from the original on April 28, 2019. Retrieved February 28, 2015.-

-"Unanimously Adopting Resolution 2199 (2015), Security Council Condemns Trade with Al-Qaida Associated Groups, Threatens Further Targeted Sanctions". United Nations. February 12, 2015. Archived from the original on April 28, 2019. Retrieved February 28, 2015.-

Data.event_text: 15  A lone gunman leaves 2 people dead in a terrorist attack in Copenhagen, Denmark.
The 2015 Cricket World Cup is held in Australia and New Zealand with Australia defeating New Zealand in the final.
The Egyptian military begins conducting airstrikes against a branch of the Islamic militant group ISIL in Libya in retaliation for the group's beheading of over a dozen Egyptian Christians.

links.text: -Kirkpatrick, David D. (February 16, 2015). "Egypt Conducts Airstrikes on Islamic State Targets in Libya". The New York Times. Archived from the original on December 26, 2018. Retrieved February 16, 2015.-

-Kirkpatrick, David D. (February 16, 2015). "Egypt Conducts Airstrikes on Islamic State Targets in Libya". The New York Times. Archived from the original on December 26, 2018. Retrieved February 16, 2015.-

Data.event_text: 8  The ancient city sites of Nimrud, Hatra and Dur-Sharrukin in Iraq are demolished by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant.

links.text: -"ISIL fighters bulldoze ancient Assyrian palace in Iraq". Al Jazeera. March 5, 2015. Archived from the original on February 24, 2018. Retrieved March 6, 2015.-
-"ISIL fighters bulldoze ancient Assyrian palace in Iraq". Al Jazeera. March 5, 2015. Archived from the original on February 24, 2018. Retrieved March 6, 2015.-

-"Reports: ISIS bulldozed ancient Hatra city in Mosul". RiyadhVision. March 7, 2015. Archived from the original on March 15, 2015. Retrieved March 8, 2015.-
-"Ancient site Khorsabad attacked by Islamic State: reports". Toronto Star. March 8, 2015. Archived from the original on March 9, 2015. Retrieved August 23, 2017.-
-"Ancient site Khorsabad attacked by Islamic State: reports". Toronto Star. March 8, 2015. Archived from the original on March 9, 2015. Retrieved August 23, 2017.-

Data.event_text: NASA's Dawn probe enters orbit around Ceres, becoming the first spacecraft to visit a dwarf planet.

links.text: -"NASA Spacecraft Becomes First to Orbit a Dwarf Planet". NASA. March 6, 2015. Archived from the original on April 17, 2016. Retrieved March 6, 2015.-
-"NASA Spacecraft Becomes First to Orbit a Dwarf Planet". NASA. March 6, 2015. Archived from the original on April 17, 2016. Retrieved March 6, 2015.-
-"Nasa's Dawn probe achieves orbit around Ceres". BBC. March 6, 2015. Archived from the original on November 7, 2022. Retrieved November 23, 2022.-
-"Nasa's Dawn probe achieves orbit around Ceres". BBC. March 6, 2015. Archived from the original on November 7, 2022. Retrieved November 23, 2022.-

Data.event_text: The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant becomes allies with fellow jihadist group Boko Haram, effectively annexing the group.

links.text: -"Isis welcomes Boko Haram's allegiance and plays down coalition 'victories'". The Guardian. theguardian.com. March 12, 2015. Archived from the original on December 3, 2017. Retrieved December 10, 2016.-

-"Isis welcomes Boko Haram's allegiance and plays down coalition 'victories'". The Guardian. theguardian.com. March 12, 2015. Archived from the original on December 3, 2017. Retrieved December 10, 2016.-

Data.event_text: A total solar eclipse was visible in the north Atlantic, Faroe Islands, and Svalbard. It was the 61st eclipse of the 120th saros cycle.
An Airbus A320-211 operated by Germanwings is deliberately crashed by First officer Andres Lubitz in the French Alps, killing all 150 people on board.

links.text: -"Germanwings plane 4U 9525 crashes in French Alps - no survivors". BBC. March 24, 2015. Archived from the original on June 18, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-
-"Germanwings plane 4U 9525 crashes in French Alps - no survivors". BBC. March 24, 2015. Archived from the original on June 18, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-

Data.event_text: A Saudi Arabia-led coalition of Arab countries starts a military intervention in Yemen in order to uphold the Yemeni government in its fight against the Houthis' southern offensive.

links.text: -"Saudi and Arab allies bomb Houthi positions in Yemen". Aljazeera. March 26, 2015. Archived from the original on March 26, 2015. Retrieved April 2, 2015.-
-"Saudi and Arab allies bomb Houthi positions in Yemen". Aljazeera. March 26, 2015. Archived from the original on March 26, 2015. Retrieved April 2, 2015.-
-Almasy, Steve; Hanna, Jason (March 26, 2015). "Saudi Arabia launches airstrikes in Yemen". CNN. Archived from the original on August 8, 2022. Retrieved April 2, 2015.-
-Almasy, Steve; Hanna, Jason (March 26, 2015). "Saudi Arabia launches airstrikes in Yemen". CNN. Archived from the original on August 8, 2022. Retrieved April 2, 2015.-

Data.event_text: The BBC refuses to renew the contract of Top Gear's main presenter Jeremy Clarkson, resulting in the end of his run on 2002 - format Top Gear.
Australia wins the 2015 Cricket World Cup.
148 people are killed, the majority students, in a mass shooting at the Garissa University College in Kenya, perpetrated by the militant terrorist organization al-Shabaab.

links.text: -Gettleman, Jeffrey (April 3, 2015). "Come Out and Live, Shabab Told Kenya Students. It Was a Lie". The New York Times. Archived from the original on June 13, 2022. Retrieved March 1, 2017.-
-Gettleman, Jeffrey (April 3, 2015). "Come Out and Live, Shabab Told Kenya Students. It Was a Lie". The New York Times. Archived from the original on June 13, 2022. Retrieved March 1, 2017.-

Data.event_text: A total lunar eclipse was visible in Asia, Australia, Pacific and Americas. It was a shallow total lunar eclipse, with 0.08% of that diameter inside of Earth's umbral shadow, and it was the 30th eclipse of the 132nd saros cycle.
A magnitude 7.8 earthquake strikes Nepal and causes 8,857 deaths in Nepal, 130 in India, 27 in China and 4 in Bangladesh with a total of 9,018 deaths.

links.text: -"Nepal earthquake: Hundreds die, many feared trapped". BBC News. April 25, 2015. Archived from the original on June 29, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-
-"Nepal earthquake: Hundreds die, many feared trapped". BBC News. April 25, 2015. Archived from the original on June 29, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-
-Rai, Bhrikuti (April 26, 2015). "Nepal earthquake death toll tops 3,200". Los Angeles Times. Archived from the original on March 27, 2022. Retrieved April 26, 2015.-
-Rai, Bhrikuti (April 26, 2015). "Nepal earthquake death toll tops 3,200". Los Angeles Times. Archived from the original on March 27, 2022. Retrieved April 26, 2015.-

Data.event_text: The World Health Organization (WHO) declares that rubella has been eradicated from the Americas.

links.text: -"Rubella (German measles) eradicated from Americas". BBC. April 29, 2015. Archived from the original on June 23, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-
-"Rubella (German measles) eradicated from Americas". BBC. April 29, 2015. Archived from the original on June 23, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-

Data.event_text: October 31  Expo 2015 is held in Milan, Italy.

links.text: -"Learn More About Expo Milano 2015". Archived from the original on May 2, 2014. Retrieved January 17, 2015.-
-"Learn More About Expo Milano 2015". Archived from the original on May 2, 2014. Retrieved January 17, 2015.-

Data.event_text: The 2015 UK General Election results in the first Conservative majority government in 18 years.
A prison break occurred in the Iraqi town of Al Khalis, resulting in over fifty escapees.
The first round of the 2015 Polish presidential election is held.

12  Version O of Les Femmes d'Alger by Pablo Picasso sells for US$179.3 million at Christie's auction in New York, while the sculpture L'Homme au doigt by Alberto Giacometti sells for US$141.3 million, setting a new world record for a painting and for a sculpture, respectively.

links.text: -Reyburn, Scott (May 11, 2015). "Two Artworks Top $100 Million Each at Christie's Sale (Artsbeat blog)". The New York Times. Archived from the original on May 14, 2015. Retrieved May 12, 2015.-
-Reyburn, Scott (May 11, 2015). "Two Artworks Top $100 Million Each at Christie's Sale (Artsbeat blog)". The New York Times. Archived from the original on May 14, 2015. Retrieved May 12, 2015.-

Data.event_text: A second major earthquake in Nepal, measuring 7.3 on the moment magnitude scale, results in 153 deaths in Nepal, 62 in India, 1 in China and 2 in Bangladesh, with a total of 218 deaths.

links.text: -"Fresh earthquake kills scores in Nepal and India". Yahoo News. May 12, 2015. Archived from the original on March 5, 2016. Retrieved January 14, 2017.-
-"Fresh earthquake kills scores in Nepal and India". Yahoo News. May 12, 2015. Archived from the original on March 5, 2016. Retrieved January 14, 2017.-
-Burke, Jason (May 12, 2015). "Nepal rocked by 7.3-magnitude earthquake near Mount Everest". The Guardian. Archived from the original on January 1, 2017. Retrieved December 10, 2016.-
-Burke, Jason (May 12, 2015). "Nepal rocked by 7.3-magnitude earthquake near Mount Everest". The Guardian. Archived from the original on January 1, 2017. Retrieved December 10, 2016.-

Data.event_text: 23  The Eurovision Song Contest 2015 is held in Vienna, Austria, and is won by Swedish entrant Måns Zelmerlöw with the song "Heroes".
ISIS captures the ancient city of Palmyra in Syria.

links.text: -"Here Are the Ancient Sites ISIS Has Damaged and Destroyed". National Geographic News. September 1, 2015. Archived from the original on August 13, 2019. Retrieved April 22, 2020.-
-"Here Are the Ancient Sites ISIS Has Damaged and Destroyed". National Geographic News. September 1, 2015. Archived from the original on August 13, 2019. Retrieved April 22, 2020.-

Data.event_text: The second round of the 2015 Polish presidential election is held, with Andrzej Duda reigning victorious over then-incumbent president Bronisław Komorowski.
In Tonga, the Mata ʻo e Laʻa Solar Facility is officially opened by King Tupou VI.

links.text: -"King receives Mata 'o e La'a Solar Facility for Tonga". Matangi Tonga Online. May 29, 2015. Retrieved January 9, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The FIFA President Sepp Blatter announces his intention to resign amidst an FBI-led corruption investigation, and calls for an extraordinary congress to elect a new president as soon as possible.

links.text: -"Sepp Blatter to resign as FIFA president amid corruption scandal". BBC Sport. February 6, 2015. Archived from the original on November 1, 2015. Retrieved February 13, 2018.-
-"Sepp Blatter to resign as FIFA president amid corruption scandal". BBC Sport. February 6, 2015. Archived from the original on November 1, 2015. Retrieved February 13, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The governments of India and Bangladesh officially ratify their 1974 agreement to exchange enclaves along their border.

links.text: -"India, Bangladesh ratify historic land deal; Narendra Modi announces new $2 billion line of credit to Dhaka". Times of India. Archived from the original on November 8, 2020. Retrieved June 29, 2016.-

-"India, Bangladesh ratify historic land deal; Narendra Modi announces new $2 billion line of credit to Dhaka". Times of India. Archived from the original on November 8, 2020. Retrieved June 29, 2016.-

Data.event_text: 28  The inaugural European Games are held in Baku, Azerbaijan.
Kobanî massacre ISIL fighters detonate three car bombs, enter Kobanî, Syria, and open fire at civilians, killing more than 220 people.

links.text: -"79 IS killed in Ein al-Arab"Kobane", and an Egyptian captive reveals the mission details". Syrian observatory for Human Rights. June 28, 2015. Retrieved June 29, 2016.-

Data.event_text: Sousse attacks 22-year-old Seifeddine Rezgui opens fire at a tourist resort at Port El Kantaoui, Tunisia, killing 38 people.

links.text: -"Tunisia beach attack: British death toll 'will top 30'". BBC News. June 28, 2015. Archived from the original on June 13, 2022. Retrieved June 29, 2016.-
-"Tunisia beach attack: British death toll 'will top 30'". BBC News. June 28, 2015. Archived from the original on June 13, 2022. Retrieved June 29, 2016.-

Data.event_text: Kuwait mosque bombing A suicide bomber attacks the Shia Mosque Imam Ja'far as-Sadiq at Kuwait City, Kuwait, killing 27 people and injuring 227 others.

links.text: -Diebel, Mathew (June 26, 2015). "At least 27 dead in ISIL-claimed Kuwait attack". USA Today. Archived from the original on April 28, 2019. Retrieved June 29, 2016.-
-Diebel, Mathew (June 26, 2015). "At least 27 dead in ISIL-claimed Kuwait attack". USA Today. Archived from the original on April 28, 2019. Retrieved June 29, 2016.-

Data.event_text: Cuba becomes the first country in the world to eradicate mother-to-child transmission of HIV and syphilis.

links.text: -"WHO validates elimination of mother-to-child transmission of HIV and syphilis in Cuba". WHO. June 30, 2015. Archived from the original on July 2, 2015. Retrieved August 30, 2015.-
-"WHO validates elimination of mother-to-child transmission of HIV and syphilis in Cuba". WHO. June 30, 2015. Archived from the original on July 2, 2015. Retrieved August 30, 2015.-

Data.event_text: Greek government-debt crisis Greece becomes the first advanced economy to miss a payment to the International Monetary Fund in the 71-year history of the IMF.

links.text: -Donnan, Shawn (June 30, 2015). "Payment failure pitches IMF into uncharted territory". Financial Times.-

Data.event_text: 13  Greek government-debt crisis After six months of clashes and futile negotiations between Greece's newly elected, leftist government and the country's creditors, over the austerity measures imposed through bailout programmes, tension peaks as Greece votes in a referendum to reject the terms offered in a third programme; however, the government eventually proceeds to concur to harsher terms than those offered before, in what was widely characterized as a coup on the creditors' part.

links.text: -"Greece debt crisis: Greek voters reject bailout offer". BBC. July 6, 2015. Archived from the original on June 13, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-
-"Greece debt crisis: Greek voters reject bailout offer". BBC. July 6, 2015. Archived from the original on June 13, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-
-"German-Led Eurozone Launching Coup Against Greek Government". Huffington Post. July 12, 2015. Archived from the original on March 1, 2019. Retrieved April 16, 2020.-
-"German-Led Eurozone Launching Coup Against Greek Government". Huffington Post. July 12, 2015. Archived from the original on March 1, 2019. Retrieved April 16, 2020.-

Data.event_text: NASA's New Horizons spacecraft performs a close flyby of Pluto, becoming the first spacecraft in history to visit the distant world.

links.text: -"New Horizons: Nasa spacecraft speeds past Pluto". BBC. July 14, 2015. Archived from the original on June 3, 2019. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-
-"New Horizons: Nasa spacecraft speeds past Pluto". BBC. July 14, 2015. Archived from the original on June 3, 2019. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Iran agrees to long-term limits of its nuclear program in exchange for sanctions relief.

Data.event_text: Cuba and the United States, ending 54 years of hostility between the nations, reestablish full diplomatic relations.

-"Cuban flag flies in Washington as relations restored". BBC News. July 20, 2015. Archived from the original on July 20, 2015. Retrieved July 21, 2015.-

Data.event_text: Turkey begins a series of airstrikes against PKK and ISIL targets after the 2015 Suruç bombing.

-Goldman, David (June 1, 2015). "Microsoft announces Windows 10 release date: July 29". CNNMoney. Archived from the original on October 27, 2023. Retrieved November 13, 2023.-

Data.event_text: The International Olympic Committee awards Beijing the right to host the 2022 Winter Olympics.
Debris found on Réunion Island is confirmed to be that of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, missing since March 2014.

links.text: -"MH370 families question Malaysian evidence". CNBC. August 6, 2015. Archived from the original on September 1, 2019. Retrieved August 6, 2015.-
-"MH370 families question Malaysian evidence". CNBC. August 6, 2015. Archived from the original on September 1, 2019. Retrieved August 6, 2015.-

Data.event_text: and 15  Large explosions in Tianjin, China kill 173 and injure more than 800 people. The causes of the explosions were found to be an overheated container of dry nitrocellulose and around 800 tonnes of ammonium nitrate.
A bombing takes place inside the Erawan Shrine at the Ratchaprasong intersection in Pathum Wan District, Bangkok, Thailand, killing 20 people and injuring 125.

links.text: -"Bangkok bomb: Explosion close to Erawan shrine kills at least 27 people including four foreigners – latest updates". The Daily Telegraph. August 17, 2015. Archived from the original on December 3, 2017. Retrieved April 5, 2018.-

-"Bangkok bomb: Explosion close to Erawan shrine kills at least 27 people including four foreigners – latest updates". The Daily Telegraph. August 17, 2015. Archived from the original on December 3, 2017. Retrieved April 5, 2018.-

Data.event_text: A UAE military intelligence operation in the country of Yemen frees one British hostage.

Queen Elizabeth II, having been on the throne for 63 years, 217 days, became the longest-reigning British monarch in history and the longest-serving head of state of any nation in modern history, surpassing Queen Victoria who had reigned for 63 years, 216 days upon her death on January 22, 1901.

links.text: -"Queen Elizabeth II to become Britain's longest reigning monarch". The Independent. August 26, 2015. Archived from the original on May 1, 2022. Retrieved April 19, 2022.-

Data.event_text: Scientists announce the discovery of Homo naledi, a previously unknown species of early human in South Africa.

-Shreeve, Jamie (September 10, 2015). "This Face Changes the Human Story. But How?". National Geographic News. Archived from the original on September 10, 2015.-

Data.event_text: A partial solar eclipse was visible in South Africa, South India and Antarctica. It was the 54th eclipse of the 125th saros cycle.[citation needed]
First observation of gravitational waves Gravitational waves are detected for the first time, by LIGO. This is not announced until February 11, 2016.

Data.event_text: Malcolm Turnbull defeats Tony Abbott in a Liberal Party leadership ballot. Turnbull becomes Prime Minister of Australia, being sworn in the following day.

Data.event_text: An 8.4 earthquake strikes 46 km from Coquimbo (in Chile). 22 people are killed and 34 more injured.
The 2015 Rugby World Cup is held in England and is won by New Zealand who beat Australia in the final.
Automaker Volkswagen is alleged to have been involved in worldwide rigging of diesel emissions tests, affecting an estimated 11 million vehicles globally.

links.text: -"Volkswagen under investigation over illegal software that masks emissions". The Guardian. September 18, 2015. Archived from the original on July 24, 2019. Retrieved September 30, 2015.-

Data.event_text: Snap legislative elections are held in Greece, following the resignation of prime minister Alexis Tsipras, to elect all 300 members of the Hellenic Parliament and the SYRIZA party, led by Alexis Tsipras comes out as the largest party winning 145 out of 300 seats.

Data.event_text: A stampede during the Hajj pilgrimage in Mecca kills at least 2,200 people and injures more than 900 others, with more than 650 missing.

links.text: -"Iran holds funeral for diplomat killed in Saudi hajj crush". Associated Press. November 27, 2015. Archived from the original on December 8, 2015. Retrieved June 29, 2016.-

Data.event_text: NASA announces that liquid water has been found on Mars.

-"NASA News Conference: Evidence of Liquid Water on Today's Mars". NASA. September 28, 2015. Archived from the original on July 18, 2021. Retrieved October 3, 2015.-

Data.event_text: Russia begins air strikes against ISIL and anti-government forces in Syria, in support of the Syrian government.

links.text: -McDonnell, Patrick J.; Hennigan, W.J. & Bulos, Nabih (September 30, 2015). "Russia launches airstrikes in Syria amid U.S. concern about targets". Los Angeles Times. Archived from the original on March 5, 2022. Retrieved June 29, 2016.-

Data.event_text: A United States airstrike on a Médecins Sans Frontières (Doctors Without Borders) hospital in Afghanistan kills an estimated 20 people.

links.text: -Rasmussen, Sune Engel (October 3, 2015). "MSF hospital: US condemned over 'horrific bombing' in Afghanistan". The Guardian. Archived from the original on January 16, 2016. Retrieved January 13, 2016.-

-Rasmussen, Sune Engel (October 3, 2015). "MSF hospital: US condemned over 'horrific bombing' in Afghanistan". The Guardian. Archived from the original on January 16, 2016. Retrieved January 13, 2016.-

Data.event_text: A series of suicide bombings kills at least 100 people at a peace rally in Ankara, Turkey, and injures more than 400 others.

links.text: -Letsch, Constanze; Shaheen, Kareem (October 12, 2015). "Turkey says Islamic State is main suspect in Ankara bombings". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Archived from the original on February 27, 2017. Retrieved February 26, 2017.-

Data.event_text: Hurricane Patricia becomes the most intense hurricane ever recorded in the Western Hemisphere and the second strongest worldwide, with winds of 215 mph and a pressure of 872 mbar.

links.text: -"Hurricane Patricia: Risk of floods and landslides". BBC News. October 24, 2015. Archived from the original on June 29, 2019. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-
-"Hurricane Patricia: Risk of floods and landslides". BBC News. October 24, 2015. Archived from the original on June 29, 2019. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The 2015 Polish parliamentary election is held for the Sejm of the Republic of Poland, with the election being won by the largest opposition party, the right-wing Law and Justice (PiS).
A magnitude 7.5 earthquake strikes the Hindu Kush region and causes 398 deaths, with 279 in Pakistan, 115 in Afghanistan and 4 in India.

links.text: -Brumfield, Ben (October 26, 2015). "Deaths, damage reported in powerful Afghanistan quake". CNN. Archived from the original on September 19, 2017. Retrieved November 6, 2015.-
-Brumfield, Ben (October 26, 2015). "Deaths, damage reported in powerful Afghanistan quake". CNN. Archived from the original on September 19, 2017. Retrieved November 6, 2015.-

Data.event_text: Colectiv nightclub fire a fire ignited by a failed fireworks show sets the walls and columns covered in foam of the Colectiv nightclub, located in Romania's capital Bucharest. 27 people die at the scene, including four out the five members of the Romanian metalcore band "Goodbye to Gravity", and 37 would succumb later due to the injuries and intoxication with fumes, but also because of the poor treatment conditions. The event and the poor management of the situation spark a riot in all of Romania, known as the "Colectiv Revolution".

Metrojet Flight 9268, an Airbus A321 airliner en route to Saint Petersburg from Sharm el-Sheikh, crashes near Al-Hasana in Sinai, killing all 217 passengers and 7 crew members on board. Later investigations revealed a bomb was likely responsible for the crash with Islamic State being the primary suspect.

Data.event_text: Romanian prime-minister Victor Ponta resigns amid calls from the people angered by the Colectiv nightclub fire, marking the end of an almost four years period of unrest in Romania. Peaceful protests would continue until .
CPC general secretary Xi Jinping and ROC president Ma Ying-jeou formally meet for the first time.
Two suicide bombers detonated explosives in Bourj el-Barajneh, Beirut, killing 43 people and injuring over 200 others.
Multiple terrorist attacks claimed by Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) in Paris, France, result in 130 fatalities.

links.text: -"Paris hit by 'three teams of attackers'". BBC News. November 15, 2015. Archived from the original on June 13, 2022. Retrieved June 12, 2018.-
-"Paris hit by 'three teams of attackers'". BBC News. November 15, 2015. Archived from the original on June 13, 2022. Retrieved June 12, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Turkey shoots down a Russian fighter jet on the TurkishSyrian border in the first case of a NATO member destroying a Russian aircraft since the 1950s.

links.text: -Keller, Jared (November 24, 2015). "A NATO Country Just Shot Down a Russian Warplane for the First Time Since the Cold War". Maxim. Archived from the original on April 13, 2021. Retrieved February 24, 2021.-

Data.event_text: The 2015 United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP 21) is held in Paris, attended by leaders from 147 nations.

-"COP21: World leaders begin high-level climate talks". BBC News. November 30, 2015. Archived from the original on June 15, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Two gunmen open fire at a workplace in San Bernardino, California, killing 14 before dying themselves in a shootout with police. ISIL claimed responsibility.

links.text: -"At least 14 dead in California shooting". December 3, 2015. Archived from the original on April 24, 2019. Retrieved April 24, 2019.-
-"At least 14 dead in California shooting". December 3, 2015. Archived from the original on April 24, 2019. Retrieved April 24, 2019.-

Data.event_text: OpenAI, a non-profit artificial intelligence research company, is founded.

-"Introducing OpenAI". OpenAI. December 12, 2015. Archived from the original on August 8, 2017. Retrieved December 23, 2022.-

Data.event_text: A global climate change pact is agreed at the COP 21 summit in Paris, committing all countries to reduce carbon emissions for the first time.

links.text: -"COP21 climate change summit reaches deal in Paris". BBC. December 12, 2015. Archived from the original on June 17, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-
-"COP21 climate change summit reaches deal in Paris". BBC. December 12, 2015. Archived from the original on June 17, 2018. Retrieved June 21, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The Islamic Military Counter Terrorism Coalition is formed in order to fight terrorism.

Data.event_text: SpaceX lands an uncrewed Falcon 9 rocket, the first reusable rocket to successfully enter orbital space and return.
